$AMC CEO yesterday on partnering with $NFLX $AAPL for exclusive theatre release window, fixing the $AMZN issue of simultaneous launch of theatre and streaming hurting both services.

As for pure streamers, “AMC would love to show Apple movies and Amazon movies and Netflix movies in our theaters and we have been in discussions on one level or another with each of these companies for quite some time,” Aron said. “But, to be fair to our existing partners, we need them to commit to a window.”

“I can actually foresee a day when streamers decide they would be better off showing their movies in theaters first. It would give those movies more stature,” he said. When? “We’ll know when we know.”

https://deadline.com/2022/04/adam-aron-oscars-amc-entertainment-cinemacon-1235010745/amp/

@Eyore $AAPL's fair value is 39$ at this time. Stocks are known to go much below fair value when market conditions aren't favorable. 
 
AAPL has indeed a historically high P/E ratio, but the P/S ratio looks even worse historically speaking and AAPL has never had worse balance sheet than it has at this moment. AAPL's debt/equity is almost 2 - one needs to price in a serious share price discount for that. All in all, it's hard to find a worse investment at this time.
